candidates.title: Prepare rc1 release
candidates.body:
This pull request prepares the following packages for release:

- xtensa-lx: 0.13.0
- esp-metadata-generated: 0.2.0
- esp-radio-rtos-driver: 0.1.0
- xtensa-lx-rt-proc-macros: 0.5.0
- esp-sync: 0.1.0
- esp-println: 0.16.0
- esp-riscv-rt: 0.13.0
- esp-metadata: 0.9.0
- esp-rom-sys: 0.1.2
- esp-hal-procmacros: 0.20.0
- esp-lp-hal: 0.3.0
- xtensa-lx-rt: 0.21.0
- esp-config: 0.6.0
- esp-backtrace: 0.18.0
- esp-alloc: 0.9.0
- esp-hal: 1.0.0-rc.1
- esp-bootloader-esp-idf: 0.3.0
- esp-phy: 0.1.0
- esp-storage: 0.8.0
- esp-rtos: 0.1.0
- esp-radio: 0.16.0

The release plan used for this release:

```json
{
  "base": "main",
  "packages": [
    {
      "package": "xtensa-lx",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.12.0",
      "new_version": "0.13.0",
      "tag_name": "xtensa-lx-v0.13.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-metadata-generated",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.1.0",
      "new_version": "0.2.0",
      "tag_name": "esp-metadata-generated-v0.2.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-radio-rtos-driver",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.0.1",
      "new_version": "0.1.0",
      "tag_name": "esp-radio-rtos-driver-v0.1.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "xtensa-lx-rt-proc-macros",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.4.0",
      "new_version": "0.5.0",
      "tag_name": "xtensa-lx-rt-proc-macros-v0.5.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-sync",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.0.0",
      "new_version": "0.1.0",

      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-println",

      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-riscv-rt",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.12.0",
      "new_version": "0.13.0",
      "tag_name": "esp-riscv-rt-v0.13.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-metadata",
      "semver_checked": false,
      "current_version": "0.8.0",
      "new_version": "0.9.0",
      "tag_name": "esp-metadata-v0.9.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {
      "package": "esp-rom-sys",

      "new_version": "0.1.2",

    },
    {

      "current_version": "0.19.0",

    {

    },
    {

      "semver_checked": false,

      "tag_name": "esp-storage-v0.8.0",
      "bump": "Minor"
    },
    {

    {

      "bump": "Minor"
    }
```

candidates.title: fixup bump version for new examples structure
candidates.body: The examples are now separate packages, so this must be handled in the dependency checks.

candidates.title: Update esp-backtrace docs
candidates.body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [ ] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [ ] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [ ] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [ ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖

#### Description
The readme table was outdated, and we already relay in `document_features` crate

#### Testing
`cargo xtask build documentation --packages esp-backtrace --chips esp32c3`

candidates.title: Merge `ECC`, `RSA`, and `SHA`  HIL into single binary
candidates.body:
AES has a bit more complicated features and envs so I skipped it.
Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

candidates.title: Remove default features from esp-rtos, update docs
candidates.body: The default features turned out to be problematic - if someone keeps esp-radio enabled but doesn't use it (and doesn't use alloc), the resulting error message is borderline incomprehensable.

candidates.title: Merge LCD_CAM HIL into single binary
candidates.body: Progress towards https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4257

candidates.title: Polish docs 💅
candidates.body:
Sorry, I mean clean up / tweak, not to translate them into a language I don't know.

This PR adds chip features to esp-hal/radio/phy docs, fixes a visual issue with config tables, fixes spelling of Wi-Fi, clarifies some things and adds a header to esp-radio's docs.

candidates.title: Touch up dependencies
candidates.body:
Most of this PR is just de-specifying patch releases for some packages (none of that being too important, it just deletes some differences), and adding support for embedded-io 0.7 to hal/radio.

Closes #4219

candidates.title: RMT: Obtain field witdths from PAC instead of esp-metadata, verify loopcount
candidates.body:
## Thank you for your contribution!

We appreciate the time and effort you've put into this pull request.
To help us review it efficiently, please ensure you've gone through the following checklist:

### Submission Checklist 📝
- [ ] I have updated existing examples or added new ones (if applicable).
- [x] I have used `cargo xtask fmt-packages` command to ensure that all changed code is formatted correctly.
- [x] My changes were added to the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal/CHANGELOG.md) in the **_proper_** section.
- [ ] I have added necessary changes to user code to the latest [Migration Guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/esp-hal).
- [x] My changes are in accordance to the [esp-rs developer guidelines](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/DEVELOPER-GUIDELINES.md)

#### Extra:
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md guide](https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/blob/main/documentation/CONTRIBUTING.md) and followed its instructions.

### Pull Request Details 📖
I realized that it's possible to obtain maximum field widths from the register specifications in the PAC, so this PR does so and removes values from esp-metadata that were effectively duplicated between PAC and metadata.

Additionally, it adds validation of the maximum loop count for continuous transmission (previously, the `u16` input was silently truncated to the actual 10 bits supported by hardware).

#### Testing
HIL tests, but they don't really test this.

candidates.title: Avoid triggering a context switch just to arm embassy timers
candidates.body: This PR introduces a trace framework and avoids yielding in order to arm embassy timers. The most visible effect of this PR is that the scheduler no longer runs multiple times in quick succession, but otherwise it should be a very mild perf positive change.

candidates.title: Prevent the blobs from controlling the PHY clock
candidates.body:
Closes #4265

esp-idf would just silently overflow and randomly disable its own PHY clocks, we instead don't let the blobs touch them at all. This might have been introduced by the blob update, but I haven't checked. (skipping changelog because of this - I don't think we had this issue in the last release)

candidates.title: Fix some timer queue related issues
candidates.body:
This PR fixes two separate issues:

- timer queue failed to wake tasks on the second core
- embassy timers previously could miss their ticks if events happened in a particular sequence

candidates.title: Remove unused deps
candidates.body: closes https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-hal/issues/4229

candidates.title: `esp-phy` the second
candidates.body: Since I forgot it in the first round (#3892), let's hope this is all.

candidates.title: Fix println feature docs
Document esp-rtos just a bit
Monitor the main stack's stack guard
Rename esp-preempt to esp-rtos
candidates.body: Closes #4137

candidates.title: Prevent double-freeing timers, ensure stack space in debug builds
candidates.body: Hopefully fixes #4194
